result.execSummary:
The defendant Trent T Downing was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: defendant agreed to $50 per month payment plan to commence on or before 12/15/15. Advised of $15 payment plan fee

Sentenced to 15 days Marquette County Jail with huber consecutive to any sentence he may be serving. Sentence to commence on or before 1/3/2016 by 7:00 p.m. clean & sober.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence he is serving.
Upon request and successful completion of all conditions, Court grants expungement under 973.015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trent T Downing

defendant.name: Downing, Trent T

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: notice from MASO- tested positive for THC & BUP
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Trent T Downing in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to Ct 1.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendatn enters No Contest plea to Ct 1.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court questions Atty Gumz.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1.
Counsel make sentencing arguments.
BY THE COURT:  Court sentences defendant to serve 15 days in the Marquette County Jail with huber, consecutive to any other sentence he may be serving.  Sentence to commence on or before January 3, 2016 at 7:00pm, clean and sober.  *Granted 2 days credit for time already served.  *Pay costs of $243.00.  *Submit DNA sample and pay the $200.00 surcharge.  *Upon request and upon successful completion of all conditions, Court grants expungement under 973.015.

ADDRESS INFO for Trent T Downing
Current: 137 W. Pioneer Park Rd., Westfield, WI 53964 United States  (Effective: 10-21-2015)
Prior: W4150 Tenore Dr, Oxford, WI 53952

Defendant Trent T Downing in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states counsel still have a few things to work out.  Requests new return date.  Atty Gumz agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Set return.  Return date scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Trent T Downing in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that parties are close to resolution but the State has to check on some things first.
Atty Gumz agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
*No contact with Kevin Kasten or his residence.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Atty Gumz waives reading.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Return date set for 8/19/15 at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Trent T Downing by video with attorney Mark Jay Gumz who appears by phone.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests cash bond with conditions.  Atty Gumz responds and requests signature bond.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets signature bond with conditions.
